A Project in
Teacher Training and Professional Standards Development
by the
\
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
Introductory Statement
This is the outline for a special limited-term, intensive project In
two related areas:
1) Teacher-training in the most effective understandings and uses
of television and radio as educational instruments. This will
involve the close cooperation of several teacher-training insti¬
tutions of the United States, and will cover both production and
utilization aspects of these media.
It will involve bringing together the skills of communications
and content area experts with those of experts in teaching pro¬
cedure and educational philosophy. The end-product of such a
project will be sound courses and curricula in this area# eventually
In all or nearly all of the schools of education and teachers
colleges of the nation. This need is of great urgency in view of
the many educationally irresponsible uses being urged (which
would in many cases only make education cheaper rather than
better and richer) and the trial and error procedures which now so
largely prevail as definitions of the educational roles of television
